result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Jay Oman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Jay Oman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant regarding DNA surcharge.

Defendant Joshua Jay Oman in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court sentences defendant to serve 20 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 18 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA, by 6-07-2016 or civil judgment.  

filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Joshua Jay Oman in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing.  Due to the lateness of the hour, court orders case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Joshua Jay Oman not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from MSDF for purposes of this hearing. Defendant on a VOP hold until 10-21-2015.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Joshua Jay Oman not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing however, the defendant was not produced.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua Jay Oman in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant is in treatment and requests a plea and sentencing date in 90 days.  No objection from the state.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM024715  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-14-15

Defendant Joshua Jay Oman in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Joshua Jay Oman in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
